meanings.definition: Covered in a thick, sticky substance
meanings.sent1: The toy was gunked with gooey slime.
meanings.sent2: Her hands were gunked with paint after the art class.
meanings.sent3: The dog's fur looked funny all gunked up with peanut butter.
meanings.sent4: The old book was gunked together with dried glue.
meanings.sent5: The car engine was gunked up with oil, making it hard to start.

meanings.definition: To become clogged or obstructed with dirt or grime
meanings.sent1: The drain gunked up with hair and soap scum.
meanings.sent2: If you don't clean the filter, it will gunk up with dust.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner gunked up when it sucked up a sock.
meanings.sent4: The gears gunked together, causing the machine to stop.
meanings.sent5: The pipes gunked with rust, causing a leak in the kitchen sink.
